page.title: 12Attitudes in Barton
page.content:
Although Barton has been part of the Borough of Preston for over ten years, it still retains its rural character. To reach Barton from the centre of Preston one has to pass through Fulwood and Broughton and pass green fields.
A few of the inhabitants of Barton can claim to have had ancestors in the village generations ago. Hovever, many have moved into the area in recent times and from more urban areas. They thus appreciate the rural scene.
Although Barton is equidistant from Preston and the small town of Garstang, there seems to be greater allegiance to Garstang than to Preston even among those who work or once lived in the larger town. For example, Preston Guild is ignored in favour of the Garstang processions.
